result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Harmon-Besch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessment], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit. If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within nine months of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety. JM
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) gj

Defendant Joshua D Harmon-Besch in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Joshua D Harmon-Besch in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 5 months at the House of Correction with credit for 62 days.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within nine months of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Joshua D Harmon-Besch in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Defendant Joshua D Harmon-Besch in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT HEARING.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.

Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the commissioner upon return on the bench warrant

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Joshua D Harmon-Besch in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Case scheduled for a final pretrial today.
The defendant now wants to change his plea.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Jury trial date of 09/16 vacated.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed:
Violation report.
cab

15RM029920  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-17-2015
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Joshua D Harmon-Besch not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense counsel advised the court would convert bail to a signature bond if defendant were to be transfered to an impatient AODA treatment facility. Defense counsel to petition the court to re-address bail impatient AODA treatment becomes available. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Riguian B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua D Harmon-Besch in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Joshua D Harmon-Besch in custody.  
Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
